CODIF_DATA.TD_DOCUMENT_TYPE: Prior information notice without call for competition
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C21

ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: NHS Durham Dales, Easington and Sedgefield Clinical Commissioning Group

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: NHS Durham Dales, Easington and Sedgefield Clinical Commissioning Group

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY_ADDITIONAL.OFFICIALNAME: NHS North Durham Clinical Commissioning Group

PROCUREMENT_LAW.P: NHS North Durham CCG and NHS Darlington CCG

TITLE.P: RFI for Non-Complex Post-Op Cataract and Virtual Community Glaucoma Monitoring Services

SHORT_DESCR.P: North of England Commissioning Support (NECS) are working for, and on behalf of, NHS Durham Dales, Easington and Sedgefield CCG, NHS North Durham CCG and NHS Darlington CCG, to conduct market engagement to obtain input and feedback as part of the development of potential service models for the provision of:
1) non-complex post-op cataract service; and
2) Virtual community glaucoma monitoring service.

North of England Commissioning Support (NECS) are working for, and on behalf of, NHS Durham Dales, Easington and Sedgefield CCG, NHS North Durham CCG and NHS Darlington CCG, to conduct market engagement to obtain input and feedback as part of the development of potential service models for the provision of:
1) Non-complex post-op cataract service; and
2) Virtual community glaucoma monitoring service.
North of England Commissioning Support (NECS) is utilising an electronic tendering tool (In-Tend) to manage this process.
It is free to register on In-Tend, which can be accessed at any time of day providing you have a working internet connection.
To register an interest in responding to this market engagement exercise and obtain a copy of the request for information documentation please navigate to the In-Tend portal:
https://in-tendhost.co.uk/nhsnecsu/aspx/Home
RFI documentation will be available on the In-Tend Portal from 16.9.2019 and the deadline for RFI responses is 12.00 noon on 14.10.2019.
Following review of the RFI responses, should the commissioner feel that further benefit can be gained by holding 1-1 sessions, these will be held at
Durham Dales, Easington and Sedgefield CCG
Sedgefield Community Hospital
Salters Lane
Sedgefield
TS21 3EE
Sessions will be held on the afternoons of:
— Wednesday 30 October,
— Thursday 31 October, and
— Friday 01 November.
Should bidders have any queries, or are having problems registering; they should contact the In-Tend helpdesk via:
The helpdesk is open Monday – Friday between 9.00 a.m. – 5.30 p.m.

Please note that this exercise is not part of any pre-qualification process. It is intended as an awareness, communication, and information gathering exercise offering an opportunity for provider organisations to help inform potential future service models and/or commissioning intentions.
Please note that all communications and RFI submissions will be conducted via the In-Tend portal.
